newsitem.title: UK: Argentina 500 mln mark bond due Thursday - dealers.
newsitem.headline: Argentina 500 mln mark bond due Thursday - dealers.

text.p: Argentina's planned 500 million mark 30-year Eurobond was expected to be launched on Thursday, dealers said on Tuesday.
Spread talk on the issue was in the high-400s basis points over Bunds, which would result in a coupon of around 12 percent.
"Demand for 30-year paper is strong at the moment, and especially for higher-yielding bonds," a Frankfurt-based syndicate manager said.
The mandate for the deal, which will be the longest dated bond Argentina has ever issued, was awarded to Deutsche Morgan Grenfell yesterday.
Argentina was also due to issue a 50 billion yen Eurobond on Wednesday with an 8.5-year maturity, dealers said.
A coupon of around six percent was expected, and Nikko was tipped as lead manager, they said.
